Reviews.Content: A Total Disgrace to Hotels I wish I had not taken word of the few good reviews that were posted. I should have known better being a travel agent. I booked this based on price and location. If you do not get anything else from this review, get this - you get what you pay for!This hotel is horrible! Here is a list of what happened to us in just the 3 nights we were there:1. Our room was attacked by termites on night 2. They were in our cosmetic bag, our lamps, under furniture, flying around the room, and crawling in our shoes. The front desk staff said This is termite season and that was it.*Upon asking for another room, we were walked two blocks to an adjacent building with a dark and scary courtyard. Outside of the room next to the door was a huge cockroach the size of my hand (and I am not exaggerating). We decided to stick it out with the termites. Only 1 night left of our stay.2. Our door to the patio could have been easily kicked in as it was wood slats and the locks were broken. Since we were on ground level we were concerned of someone breaking in.3. We were right outside of the breakfast station and we watched the pigeons eating the food prior to the guests coming to get it.4. The bed sheets had holes, stains, and hair.5. The furniture was so old and some tables were wobbling.6. The room smelled of mold and dampness7. Carpets had to be 30 years old.8. The bathroom had ceiling leaks and the sink did not work properly.I had never felt unsafe anywhere I have traveled until this trip. We didn't even want to return to the hotel each day. We kept our socks on it bed and walking around the room, and the whole place killed the mood. I actually cried one night. Our complaints went unnoticed by the staff and I never received a return call from the manager even though I left 3 messages.
Reviews.Author: SavageTraveler

Reviews.Content: Great location - Disgusting room The St. Helene has a great location, and the potential to be charming, quaint and romantic. But, it is the worst kept hotel I've ever visited. The room was dirty, drapes falling off the windows, stained comforter, upholstered furniture torn, bathtub disgusting, horrible bed linens ... ruined our trip. We couldn't stand the thought of going back to the room. Only stayed one night.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: great location Great location about 2 blocks away from bourbon street and a few blocks away from the shopping district. I walked in and reserved a room on a weekend and it was the best value. This hotel served its purpose if you're just wanting to party you wouldnt worry about little knick knacks the hotel needs to improve on.They do need to work on their plumbing (clogging).The rooms were just right i had the balcony view and i enjoyed it.The furniture was very french. I noticed that bars and restaurants charge individuals to use their restrooms if you are not a paying customer. Since the hotel was so close it was convenient to walk back and forth. Their is no ice machine but if you ask politely they get the ice for you.I enjoyed it very much the management and staff were kind.I had a great experience.
Reviews.Author: twinkles43

Reviews.Content: Perfect little hotel, great price We stayed here for Mardi Gras and it was wonderful. We were booking our hotel a little late in the game, and this was the cheapest hotel I could find online (seriously--I mean the one with the absolute LOWEST rate) in the French Quarter, but it looked so cute in the pictures. And it was! (How often does it happen that the cheapest place is also the best?) Beautiful balconies on the outside (the kind of place that made you feel like you were really in New Orleans). We stayed in a room on the first floor towards the back. It was small, but beautifully decorated (i.e., not the standard-issue orange graphic-print comforter all the chain hotels seem to have). Antique-looking furniture. And the location couldn't be better for hanging out on Bourbon Street. I was a little worried beforehand that we'd be up all night due to the noise of Mardi Gras, but we couldn't hear a peep from our room. I'd definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A Poor Excuse, Especially for the Price We stayed in one of the third floor front balcony rooms. We enjoyed the balcony greatly. We can not say the same for overall situation. I can only assure the reader we were polite at all times in dealing with the personnel, though on a couple of occaisions they were less than gracious to us. PROBLEM (1) On a three night stay only when we checked in was the bed made and fresh towels in the room as they should have been. After the first night the room was made up around 5 in the afternoon after we called the front desk. After the second night the room was never made up, though we brought it to the front desk's attention around 3 in the afternoon. I went down and got fresh towels around 10:30 when we got back to our room. NOTE: The clerk had to raid towels from another room that was unoccupied. PROBLEM (2) They have no ice machine and some rude front desk people. The first evening I went down and asked for ice which the desk person gave me from some bags in a freezer that is in a side office right beside the front counter. The second afternoon (when the room was late being made up) my wife went down for ice and the clerk said they had no ice and SENT HER TO ANOTHER HOTEL AROUND THE CORNER, which she did. When she returned and told me what had happened, I went down to the front desk and politely asked for ice to which the clerk said there was none. I asked Don't you have a freezer or cooler for ice? The clerk said 'No'. So I went around the side of the partition, opened the freezer and found three bags of ice. I asked if it was OK for me to use some of that ice. He said, in an unbecoming tone, that he thought they were out of ice and yes I could have some ice. I was polite at all times, all I wanted was ice (and my room made up). PROBLEM (3) The building has maintenance problems. The elevator didn't work half the time. Two big floor tiles were loose in the bathroom. The closet door would not open because it was being used to hold the A/C vent in the ceiling closed. One of the two lamps in the bedroom bulb burned out and was never replaced. The carpet badly needed vacuuming. There was low water pressure and the hot water never got much over slightly warm. PROBLEM (4) When we checked out, we discussed the situation with the manager. She apologized and promised a refund of one nights room rate. We're still waiting as of this date, two months later.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great location and price I am a budget traveler, the price was right so I booked however upon making my reservations at this hotel I discovered many bad comments about the property. I called and talked to the gentleman on duty. He was very polite and assured my room was a nice one. I arrived and I was pleasantly surprised. My room was not a suite but a basic room. This room was a very decent room. It was interior right by the great little pool and courtyard. The noise was never a problem. My stay was excellent. I have stayed in many budget places and this one is beyond better with alot more character. Great restaurants close to hotel, front desk very helpful, housekeeping good, price great. Overall call after you make your reservation they will accomidate you. I will return.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A Little Gem in the Quarter We just returned from a wonderful weekend in NO..... We were hesitant to stay at St Helene when reading previous reviews, I have come to the conclusion that people love to complain..... Hotel St Helene is a quaint  charming hotel in the quarter with lots of New Orleans charm, great courtyard  staff. Thanks to Leslie, Johnette, Orlando and Lavell for a wonderful stay, will definetely return
Reviews.Author: islandguy58

Reviews.Content: Crappy Room, Gorgeous Girl We stayed here in mid February of this year. The hotel is not great, the rooms are small with a musty odor. The carpets are filthy, our TV in our room didn't work. and some others we spoke to who were also staying at the hotel had problems with the heating/air conditioning in their rooms. Sometimes our room was not touched by housekeeping and we had to request towels from the front desk. The front desk staff were awesome though, well one in particular. If you do decide to stay at this hotel, pray to God that Shanda(I'm sorry if I spelled her name wrong) is working the front desk during your stay. Not only was she a stunningly beautiful Goddess who brightened up our day each time we stepped foot into the lobby of this rhymes with spit hole, she was also very nice and friendly, and she went above and beyond her duties to make sure we were happy, a hard thing to do in a place like the Ste. Helene. She earned her pay that week, even though she was front desk she was everywhere trying to clean up messes at this place. Her supermodel looks, beautiful smile, and incredible personality more than made up for the crappy state of the hotel. If you want to encounter an Amazonian Goddess with a smile and eyes that will light up a room and make a grown man weep, go to the Ste. Helene and ask for Shanda, if you care about where you lay your head at night, go somewhere else.
Reviews.Author: darnskippy

Reviews.Content: Older Hotel with great information I recently stayed at the Hotel St Helene in New Orleans as part of a fun weekend. This is the kind of hotel you want to stay in if you are looking for great location (in the middle of the quarter) with a Big Easy feel. I would not recommend bringing your laptop or other personal, expensive items into the hotel unless you are at least getting a junior suite. Also, phone calls are very exspensive so I would suggest a cell. Keep in mind the hotel is in the middle of the quarter; this means in the summer especially the smell from the streets is pretty strong. However, the courtyard and art inside the hotel was very trendy, however quaint. If you are ooking for fun party nights and a young, go lucky feel, this hotel was perfect as the staff was very educated in the goings-on of the city and had great tips on where to drink up. I would recoomend this hotel to the traveller who wants to experience Bourbon Street for all it has to offer.
Reviews.Author: brylync

Reviews.Content: True Mardi Gras Times The people at the hotel were very helpful and nice. I met two of my buddies down there from for mardi gras celebrations. I read other peoples reviews after I had already purchased the room so I was a little nervious. The room wasent that big but it worked for us. whenever we needed towels the maid brought them right up. I don't know how the other people writing reviews treated the staff but I know we were joking and polite to them from the begining and they were more than helpful in our stay there. The location was the best, two short blocks from the middle of burbon st. I never heard any street noise. The hotel is old but whenever we had an issue the staff was more than willing to help. By the way we had an awesome time down there, can't wait to go again. P.S. Try the Crawfish at the market cheap and tasty
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Believe what you read! Pay attention to these ratings! We just got back from a stay here. We are veteran travelers who have had a variety of experiences in hotels but this was absolutely the worst! I have been to N.O. many times and understand the ambience of a 100+ year old building and the noise of the quarter but have a hard time with dust on the furniture, carpets not vacuumed, dirty sheets and such. Our door knob came off in our hand the first night and was never fixed. No mattress cover or fitted sheet on the bottom so you fight with keeping the bottom sheet on the bed. The bedspread looked as if it had been washed million times with rolls of the cotton backing coming off. One day no bath mat, one day no hand towels. Bed headboard not attached to the bed. We were afraid of being whacked in the head at night. Luckily we only stayed in the room to sleep-quite an adventure in itself with the street noise. The only parking is across the street at a U Park garage. Definitiely don't use that one because they tried to rip us off and became very confrontational and belligerent. I'm still writing the Better Business Bureau about that one! The only plus for this place is the location. But for money and cleaniless I'd check out the Hotel Chateau or the Hotel Provincial down the street.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: It is a shame there are people like this in the world. I made a reservation 4 months in advance with a credit card and was told that half the amount would be charged to my credit card and the rest would be payable when we arrived. The next day my wife, who was at work when the reservation was made, said she did not want to stay there. She called them to cancel the reservation, but was told we would not be given our deposit back. They did not indicate at the time the reservation was made that we would not be able to cancel our reservation with a refund. However, when my wife called her credit card company, they had charged the whole amount, which was $281.00, not the half the amount the reservation person had told me. If they act this way 4 months in advance, what else would they try to do to us? They just can鈥檛 be trusted.It is a shame there are people like this in the world.We are retired and this was our first stop on our final long awaited vacation.
Reviews.Author: Hoppy3927

Reviews.Content: beyond disgusting!! never darken their door!! We should have learned the first time we stayed there and encountered filthy carpets, stained furniture, and really really moldy bathrooms. They are in a perfect location and supposedly have a new owner so we bit, and stayed there again, however, nothing could have prepared us for our recent 5 night stay during mardi gras. We are pretty laid back, and we travel to New Orleans about every 8-10 weeks to enjoy the city. We have stayed all over town in different types of lodgings ie; bed and breakfasts, condo rentals, big chain hotels, etc. In our travels here we have encountered lots of typical new orleans plagues and rolled with it, but the Saint Helene has proven to be the most disgusting both times. Someone barfed ALOT into a potted plant that was directly at the bottom of the stairs that lead up to all the rooms. It happened our 2nd night and was still there, untouched when we left days later. There was another staircase that had a used condom on the tread that appeared our third night and was never removed. At the top of the stairs was a huge, thick, pool of bird poop from many birds over time that was unavoidable but easily could have been washed away. The staff never cleaned our room, never replaced the glasses (5 nights, same glasses, we found plastic ones at a bar!) The sheets had old blood stains on the edge and the staff remade the bed with the same linens after I requested new ones the first night. Old dried soap foam stalactites on the metal soap holder in the shower. Old whisker shavings over the bathroom surfaces. The bathroom mirror was not framed (and had very sharp edges) or attatched to the wall! It was resting on the sink!! Sooo Dangerous!!! We went to the desk to get more toilet paper and tissue when we ran out as the phone had no numbers to call for desk help and no directory. Nice wood floors had huge dust bunnies. The room itself was quite large but looked comically empty as there was only one chair, a bed, and a floor lamp. No tables! No place to put anything! We asked if they had ANY sort of table, tv tray, banquet table, anything! They said no. There was more, but this has become a novel. We paid 180.00 per night here, and in another hotel it would have been fair for the dates and location. This was money truly thrown away. Avoid this place like the plaque!! This hotel group has a couple other lodgings in the area and I wouldn't give them our business if they were reviewed as the best in town. This company is AWFUL!!Thank you for your time, I hope this informed you!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: New Orleans Hotels gotta love em! Ok well let me just start by saying that if you would like to feel New Orleans the real way stay here. It is not a fancy hotel or a chain it is a small hotel right in the French Quarter. I love the location of this old place and really thats what you are paying for. I stay here everytime I stay in New Orleans. I have noticed a few minor problems with structural damage, but hello New Orleans is under sea level and sinking every day! The rooms have older decor but thats the feel of this place. The pool is one of few in the French Quarter. There is a parking garage right across the street (hard to find in quarter). I think if you dont mind small things your stay here will be pleasureable. The staff is very accomodating. You should give this place a try and enjoy New Orleans and the French Quarter the real way!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: the worst ever We booked a stay at Hotel St. Helene expecting a nice, clean, pleasant hotel based on the web-site pics and the price for a night ($220.00). Upon arrival we were disappointed to find our room dingy, dark and dank, not to mention around the corner from the main hotel. We also had plumbing problems and were told to use the bathroom down the hall when we needed too. After we thought the nightmare was over, weeks later, we received a call from our travel companions saying they had charged them for our room! This matter is still unresolved. Needless to say, this is the worst hotel experience ever. Also, there are no coke machines, ice machines, etc.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Disgustingly dirty! This was the worst hotel we have ever stayed in, without a doubt. The carpets were black with dirt, the bed linens dirty and had blood splatters on my pillowcase, dust everywhere, and mould in the bathroom. It was a terrible experience; we were misled by the lovely brochure.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: First Stay and Last Stay Stayed first week Oct 04 for 3 days. Quoted a price which was confirmed by fax to me. A 50% non refundable deposit taken (who else takes a 50% non refundable deposit - maybe this should have been a warning .... trapped in the web of 50% money down forces you to stay the journey I suppose )On check out they had problems with their computer and were unable to provide me with a receipt and said that one would be posted (I'm still waiting). They also would process the balance of the room charge and when my statement arrived I noticed that I had been overcharged by approx 100 dollars and despite phonecalls and faxes have not been recredited from this 6 weeks later, As for the hotel, a buffet breakfast to be avoided.THe room need a serious makeover even allowing for the quaintness of the age of the building. As mentioned elsewhere I'd swear the sheets were not clean and the blankets/bed covers looked in serious need of replacement. Also towels were not replaced on one day. They appeared to have foldedthe used towels and put them back and we had to get fresh towels from reception. And on two days the cleaners left the room unlocked after cleaning the room which is rather alarming.There was no door between the bedroom and the washhandbasin element of the washroom.The room has a TV and it works when you turn it on but it doesnt receive any channels !Better hotels lie within close proximity Other than that New orleans is enjoyable, the weather was great (better than Ireland!) and the tours were enjoyable. Starbucks coffee was available within a close walk on Canal St !
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Filthy, Dirty, and Damaged This was the most disgusting room I have ever stayed in. The area rugs were almost black with dirt. The toilet was located across the hall from the shower. The door to the toilet was broken as if someone had been trying to get out and busted through the door. The closet where the toilet was, was about 2 1/2 feet wide. The toilet paper holder was broken of the wall. A vine was growing in through a window. Big holes in the bathroom towels. The light fixture above the bed was kind of taped together. There were piles of crumbling plaster in a corner. Stains on the bed linens!! The floors were filthy. And some nice glue traps for mice or bugs. I have pics if your interested.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Skip the St. Helene This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. It was filthy, dangerous and extremely inconvenient. I've stayed at nicer super 8 motels.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Ste Helene, know what you're getting into I read these reviews and decided to give Ste. Helene a chance. It turned out to be a quaint hotel with a lovely courtyard, minus the algae-bottomed swimming pool. But the rooms smelled musty and housekeeping service was horrible. The bed cover obviously had not been washed (I got bug bites from it), and there were stains under the toilet seat which I discovered that night. The next day the maid came through, didn't bother changing the sheets, didn't clean the toilet. The bed was fixed and we had new towels, but that was about it. They didn't even provide a spare roll of toilet paper, which I had to ask for at the front desk. I'm normally not picky when it comes to housekeeping, but these are basic things that should've been taken care of. We also stayed there during a thunderstorm. I was sitting on the toilet when the ceiling started dripping water on my exposed bottom. We were fortunate to get a balcony room on Chartres St., but it faces the back of a large hotel and delivery and garbage trucks started making a racket at 6:30am. Overall, it was a quaint, charming hotel but needs improvement with housekeeping and maintenance.
Reviews.Author: poopie22

Reviews.Content: Loved It The first room they put us in was brand new but it was in an awful courtyard - very scary. WE had to stay the first night as they needed to get another room ready - I was very unahappy. We asked to be put into a room as described in our reservation and they did move us to a really great room with a patio outside and fountain. It was lovely. The hotel is next to everything that is worth seeing or doing. We had a wonderful times in New Orleans.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Native New Orleanian Tomorrow my husband and I will be sharing a room at the Hotel Ste. Helene and I'm looking forward to it! This is the second year that we have done this for my birthday. I've been reading some of the reviews and I have to just laugh at those who condemn the hotel because it's old and run down and they saw a rodent! Where the heck did you think you were?!!! This is New Orleans...people come here to see the old historic buildings and sights. New Orleans is OLD people, the buildings are OLD! If you want new and shiny and a bell hop and 24 hour exterminators and a big swimming pool, then stay at the Omni or one of the other chain hotels. If you want to truly experience New Orleans, walking through the iron gate, and through the courtyard, up the old wooden stairs to get to your room, then this is the place for you! I grew up in an apartment house owned by my family in the heart of the French Quarter and visiting this hotel has brought back some wonderful childhood memories! I would recommend this hotel if you truly would like a momentary glimpse into quarter living.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not too bad, authentic New Orleans Stayed here one night last year and found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. It's convienient to Bourbon St. and Jackson Square, but not so close you hear the noise from there while sleeping. It is a renovated old historical house and a little musty, but b/c of that room was very large room with high ceilings. Furniture is a little worn, but they are antiques and it adds to the experience. It has a back in time feel to it that some may not like, but I enjoyed. Pool area in the back is a very pretty garden, and it very relaxing at night. We got a weekend room for $99.Finding some clean cups for water in the morning was a challange, and we had to make our own coffee downstairs.Overall this was a pleasant stay, however I prefer to pay a little more for a modern hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Home Sweet Home I'm an future repeat guest of the St. Helene. This is a nice small quaint hotel right within walking distance to every place you think you may like to visit in the french quarter. We were very satisfied with our accomadations. The staff at this hotel is Unbelievable, we didn't have to lift a figure for anything. They directed us to great resturants, shopping areas, Jazz Clubs I mean, the list just goes on and on. We visit New Orleans often and spend so much time looking for the perfect place to give us the real feel of New Orleans and finally found it. We're looking forward to return to the St. Helene ..year... after year... after year......
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: has its good points I can't speak for the experience of others, but this was my 3rd time to N.O. and I found some positive qualities of the Hotel Ste. Helene. The staff could not have been more friendly. The maintenance man noticed my son forgot a towel while swimming and retrieved him one without anyone even asking. Our air conditioning worked fabulously and the little breakfast by the ornate pool was quite satisfactory. People must realize that the building is about 300 years old. You find the same type of atmosphere if you visit the older countries of Europe. Yes, it is not your typical Marriot or Days Inn. It has its own ambience and the real feel of old New Orleans. and Yes, the carpets could use some cleaning but I've seen worse in French Quarter hotels. I got a great deal with expedia so the price was worth it.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very quaint and cozy Convenient location and quaint courtyard made this a romantic suite for me and my boyfriend. It's very no-frills but clean enough for this New Yorker. I recommend it!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Balcony! Stayed during Jazz fest. The room was very tiny and unfortunatley the stories about dirty carpet is all too true! This place would/could be a terrific place to stay is they would do some upgrades. The cleaning staff did a so so job in replenishing items and the tub was dirty. BUT, the BALCONY and the LOCATION could not be beat! AWESOME! And the hotel staff was more than accomodating and friendly! Bottom line if they did upgrades like new carpet and alot more cleaning this place has serious potential!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: For my money it's the Hotel St. Helene! I just love this hotel. The rooms are clean  the staff go above  beyond what is expected of them. Talk about location, the hotel sits right in the French Quarter, near all major attractions. The buildings that house the hotel are a National treasure  give you a real New Orleans feel! For my money it's the Hotel St. Helene!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: St. Helene does not measure up I was pretty disappointed with Hotel St. Helene in the French Quarter of New Orleans. Basically the hotel is clean but very run-down and shabby and one does not expect that given the current room rates. Although, the hotel is in a safe and convenient area of the French Quarter--not much else is good about it. The hotel ad promises free champagne or cocktails nightly--which never did materialize, although we were there 4 nights! We were given various excuses by different desk clerks, who change daily so no body is accountable. Desk clerks themselves are a problem as they will give you erroneous information--I was misled about a literary walking tour, by a desk clerk, which made me miss the tour! There is a pool but it was full of leaves while we were there and no body attempted to clean it until the morning we left! The continental breakfast is adequate--coffee and rolls, or muffins--self-service. Rooms staff is friendly, clean towels daily. I would not recommend this hotel based on my experience, although as I said the location was great.
Reviews.Author: Mums9

Reviews.Content: True Nawlin's at it' Wow, I found these reviews while looking for this hotel, because we had such a wonderful experience at the St. Helene, I was looking for their website to plan a return trip. We stayed with 10 couples for a 40th birthday party in 2002. We were ALL upgraded to suites, each with a jaxuzzi tub... the guest of honor stayed in an awesome suite, room 202, I think, jacuzzi for 4, great decor, sitting room and balcony. One of the funnest trips we've taken. Hospitality was great, breakfast every morning, plenty of hot water, comfy beds, it was a nawlins' experience. There is no pool. Excellent location, close to everything and not too far from Bourbon St. This is were we stayed our first trip to New orleans, we've been back and stayed in one of the hotel casinos... no ambiance there. If you want to experience the town, the St. Helene is great! And my friends call me a hotel snob... always ask for the upgrade!
Reviews.Author: TandB1

Reviews.Content: bachelor party weekend i found this page 2 days before we left for this trip to new orleans. i was horrified by the reviews i read and after an hour, i called the bachelor to let him know. i felt he ought to know what place i had gotten us.turns out, this place was nothing like any of these bad reviews got. granted we were 6 guys down there with partying on our mind, but i still would not have minded taking my wife to stay here. we stayed in the main building and the rooms were clean, i didn't see any rodents and the free breakfast was good from what some of the guys said.do not be afraid to stay here. my gut feeling is some of these people just dind't think that new orleans was very clean and ran the room into the middle of it.could not beat the hotel for the price and how much time do you spend in your hotel room when your down there anyways???
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Terrible Hotel Worst hotel I've ever stayed at. No ameneties-no bell hops, no room service, no concierge. Heat/air conditioning didn't work. Froze in 50 degree room - management never fixed - I ended up finding the circuit breaker and shutting down the air conditioning that would not shut off. Dirty, gross stains on carpets and ceiling. Maid service a joke - room not vacumed or ash trays emptied during entire 4 day stay. Swimming pool located in dank, dirty, sunless courtyard. Its not much bigger than a child's wading pool and has green scum growing in it. Hotel took the liberty of over charging my credit card and the desk clerk refused to issue a refund . Avoid this dump!! - do not give them your credit card number! They demand full payment in advance and refuse a refund. I can understand why - no one would stay there once they see the place if they hadn't payed in advance.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Truly awful! (This review is a bit late because I only recently discovered this wonderful website.) My first visit to New Orleans in 2002 was ruined by the Ste-Helene Hotel experience. As the other reviewers report, it is rather disgusting. Old, dirty, a/c didn't work and lots of dripping noises. Fake advertising is the only way they get guests to come, I guess. When I first checked in, my room was so hideous and nightmarish that I went back to the reception and requested a better room. Okay, they were accommodating and did assign me another room but it was only a marginal improvement. At least it didn't look creepy, dark and gothic - but still old and filthy. Being without resources, I told myself to suck it up for the 3 nights. How much time does one spend in a hotel room. But it really does affect your mental state if you don't get any sleep over 3 nights. If I revisit, I'd want to pay more for another hotel.
Reviews.Author: IntrepidfromMontreal

Reviews.Content: Valentine's Weekend nightmare.... Basically everything you read in previous posts is correct. We stayed over Valentine's Day weekend and had a host of problems: furnace which constantly blew warm heat and didn't adequately cool the room (and I was afraid to sleep with the window open...); terrible bed (comforter had too many unknown stains....) and the pillows were even worse; bad t.v. reception; and and intermittenly working hairdrier. We never even tried to find the continental breakfast or happy hour, but the staff never told us it was available, either. Overall the staff was nice and helpful, but this didn't make up all of the shortcomings. In the end, you get what you pay for, and for $150 the location was great - but I would have preferred the Omni at whatever price across the street.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hotel Ste. Nightmare Hotel Ste. Helene should be re-named to Hotel Ste. Nightmare! My boyfriend and I vacationed in New Orleans for the first time this past December. Since this was our first trip we, of course, bought all the travel books and checked out many hotels. Hotel Ste. Helene promised to be very authentic with beautifully decorated rooms, etc, etc. We were extremely disappointed with the accomodations, the air didn't work properly and the small size of the room was ridiculous, even for two. But the final straw that ended in us demanding a refund and immediately leaving the hotel was a rather large rat that decided to peek out from behind the dresser just in time for me to catch a glimpse of him. Needless to say we packed immediately and booked a room at the near by Omni Royal New Orleans (which I highly recommend).The only way I would recommend going to Hotel Ste. Helene is if you enjoy small, hot, dirty rooms with some unexpected guests...
